REQUIRE.Description: REQUIRE DoH (no unencrypted fallback) - Maximum security
REQUIRE.BestFor: Home users, single-network systems, maximum privacy
REQUIRE.Warning: May cause connectivity issues in corporate networks, captive portals, or mobile hotspots

ALLOW.Description: ALLOW DoH (fallback to UDP if DoH fails) - Balanced
ALLOW.BestFor: VPN users, mobile devices, multi-network systems, enterprise environments
ALLOW.Warning: Less secure - DNS queries may fall back to unencrypted UDP

PROHIBIT.Description: PROHIBIT DoH (disable encrypted DNS) - Not recommended
PROHIBIT.BestFor: Legacy systems, specific enterprise requirements only
PROHIBIT.Warning: All DNS queries will be unencrypted

DoHPolicy.Recommendation: Use REQUIRE for home networks, ALLOW for VPN/mobile/enterprise

Notes: REQUIRE mode (default): Best privacy, but may break in corporate/captive portal networks or with VPNs
ALLOW mode: Good balance for VPN users, mobile users and enterprise environments
Users with VPNs or on multiple networks should choose ALLOW mode
PROHIBIT mode is NOT recommended - only for specific legacy requirements
